Algae.name: Algae
Algae.description: We do not use algae (Spirulina) because IBD involves the immune system and algae can aggravate an already disturbed immune system.

Allspice.name: Allspice
Allspice.description: As long as you're just using Allspice as a cooking spice it's legal. Don't use the oil see Allspice

Almond butter.name: Almond butter
Almond butter.description: Almond butter with no sugar added is allowed.

Almond milk.name: Almond milk
Almond milk.description: May be tried after being on the diet for 6 months.

Almonds.name: Almonds
Almonds.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour in recipes until diarrhea has subsided.

Aloe Vera.name: Aloe Vera
Aloe Vera.description: It contains mucilaginous polysaccharides as well as increasing the release of tumor necrosis factor which is associated with IBD inflammation and increased immune stimulation.

Amaranth flour.name: Amaranth flour
Amaranth flour.description: Amaranth is a grain substitute, contains starches and so is not allowed.

Apple Juice.name: Apple Juice
Apple Juice.description: It is brown and not clear as apple juice is. It should be just straight pressed apples. It is usually pasteurized in order to kill bacteria. Cider should be diluted with water before drinking.

Apples.name: Apples
Apples.description: Apple juice usually has sugar added during processing. Apple cider is allowed. It should be brown and not clear as apple juice is. Cider should be diluted with water before drinking.

Arrowroot.name: Arrowroot
Arrowroot.description: It is a mucilaginous herb. Mucilaginous herbs are loaded with starch. This starch is food for the pathogens that the SCD™ is designed to starve out.

Artichokes (French).name: Artichokes (French)
Artichokes (French).description: They are the green artichokes that you steam then dip the leaves in lemon butter and scrape off with your teeth. They have edible hearts and an inedible choke.

Artichokes (Jerusalem).name: Artichokes (Jerusalem)
Artichokes (Jerusalem).description: They are actually a tuber and are not legal.

Ascorbic acid.name: Ascorbic acid
Ascorbic acid.description: Should be nothing but Vitamin C.

Asparagus.name: Asparagus
Asparagus.description: Fresh or frozen is allowed. Canned vegetables are not allowed.

Aspartame.name: Aspartame
Aspartame.description: When symptom free one aspartame sweetened soft drink per week is allowed - Elaine. But see Aspartame in Knowledge Base.  http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/aspartame/

Avocado oil.name: Avocado oil
Avocado oil.description: Good for mayonaise and salad dressings but might not withstand heat very well

Bacon.name: Bacon
Bacon.description: Smoked bacon that has been fried very crisply is allowed once per week. There are sugar-free bacons available and if you are able to find a source of sugar-free bacon you do not have to limit your consumption to once per week. Usually the low sodium varieties do not contain sugar but check the labels carefully.

Baker's yeast.name: Baker's yeast
Baker's yeast.description: Saccharamyces cerevisae is baker's yeast and is illegal.

Baking powder.name: Baking powder
Baking powder.description: Has starch as an ingredient (usually corn starch) and other illegals to make it rise better.

Balsamic vinegar.name: Balsamic vinegar
Balsamic vinegar.description: It's not that balsamic vinegar is illegal it's that what you can get in the store isn't really balsamic vinegar and most have sugar added to them so Elaine doesn't allow it. You can make your own legal substitute though see scdrecipe

Bananas.name: Bananas
Bananas.description: They must be ripe with black spots on the skin.

Bark tea.name: Bark tea
Bark tea.description: Bark tea (Pau d'Arco) contains steroidal saponins and is both an immune booster and a laxative.

Bean flour.name: Bean flour
Bean flour.description: Do not use ready made flours made from beans or lentils as they probably weren't soaked prior to grinding to bean flour.

Bee Pollen.name: Bee Pollen
Bee Pollen.description: Pollen is irritating to a damaged gut. Clear pure pasteurized honey is okay. Cloudy honey (still containing the pollen) should be avoided. - Sheila

Beef.name: Beef
Beef.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

Berries.name: Berries
Berries.description: Berries of all kinds are legal.

Bhindi.name: Bhindi
Bhindi.description: No okra (bhindi) or drumsticks since they are a mucilaginous food they are illegal.

Black beans.name: Black beans
Black beans.description: May be tried when symptom free. Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book Breaking the Vicious Cycle.'

Black radish.name: Black radish
Black radish.description: It is very fibrous so go slowly and be careful.

Bok Choy.name: Bok Choy
Bok Choy.description: Bok Choy is much like cabbage and is legal, but you should not use a member of the cabbage family until you are well on your way to getting better. In other words do not use if you still have diarrhea and gas.

Bouillon cubes.name: Bouillon cubes
Bouillon cubes.description: Bouillon cubes and instant soup bases are not permitted.

Brazil nuts.name: Brazil nuts
Brazil nuts.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed as most are roasted with a starch coating.

Cabbage.name: Cabbage
Cabbage.description: You should not use a member of the cabbage family until you are well on your way to getting better. In other words do not use if you still have diarrhea and gas.

Canned fish.name: Canned fish
Canned fish.description: Canned in oil or water is acceptable but check the labels carefully. Do not buy products containing "broth". Usually the low sodium varieties do not contain "broth".

Canned fruits.name: Canned fruits
Canned fruits.description: Fruits canned in their own juice are allowed.

Canned vegetables.name: Canned vegetables
Canned vegetables.description: There are no canned vegetables permitted they must either be fresh or frozen.

Carrageenan.name: Carrageenan
Carrageenan.description: Carrageenan is seaweed and high in polysaccharides therefore illegal.

Cashews.name: Cashews
Cashews.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed as most are roasted with a starch coating.

Cauliflower.name: Cauliflower
Cauliflower.description: Cauliflower is sometimes hard to digest and should be tried cautiously after some progress has been made on the diet.

Celeriac /celery root.name: Celeriac /celery root
Celeriac /celery root.description: However you should go slow and be careful. It is very fibrous even if it doesn't seem so when you steam it and mash it.

Cellulose (in supplements).name: Cellulose (in supplements)
Cellulose (in supplements).description: Cellulose in your supplements is okay and virtually impossible to avoid.

Cereals.name: Cereals
Cereals.description: However for a hot cereal recipe see SCDrecipe Hot cereal: http://www.scdrecipe.com/recipes/r_006_00407.php

Chard.name: Chard
Chard.description: Chard (red, green, rainbow and swiss). Chard is similar to spinach/celery so it is legal. It also reminds me a bit of the cabbage family so use with caution if gas is still a problem - Elaine

Cheese.name: Cheese
Cheese.description: If a cheese is not a processed cheese (manufactured) but is a cheese that has had a bacterial culture involved with its production and is aged at least 30 days. Elaine says its OK.

Cherimoya.name: Cherimoya
Cherimoya.description: Also known as custard apple or sharifa.

Chestnuts.name: Chestnuts
Chestnuts.description: May be tried when symptom free. However if you buy dried chestnuts soak them and cook them until soft.

Chevre.name: Chevre
Chevre.description: Chevre is illegal but you can make a close approximation by dripping goat milk yogurt. Directions can be found at http://uclbs.org/recipes/dairy/suegoatcheese.php

Chewing gum.name: Chewing gum
Chewing gum.description: Contains things like aspartame, maple or date sugar and other sugar substitutes which are illegal.

Chickory root.name: Chickory root
Chickory root.description: Chickory root is not legal. In my first book I suggested that it might be used instead of coffee beans. I have since learned that it contains large amounts of fructooligosaccharides. - Elaine

Chlorella.name: Chlorella
Chlorella.description: It is a blue-green algae similar to spirulina

Chocolate.name: Chocolate
Chocolate.description: Dr. Haas advised not to use cocoa or chocolate and this still goes it isn't just the sugar he was worried about.

Citric Acid.name: Citric Acid
Citric Acid.description: Citric acid as an additive is OK

Cocoa powder.name: Cocoa powder
Cocoa powder.description: Dr. Haas advised not to use cocoa or chocolate and this still goes it isn't just the sugar he was worried about.

Coconut.name: Coconut
Coconut.description: Fresh or unsweetened shredded coconut and coconut flour are all legal.

Coconut milk.name: Coconut milk
Coconut milk.description: May be tried after being on the diet for 6 months.

Coconut oil.name: Coconut oil
Coconut oil.description: Withstands heat well good for frying/cooking

Coffee.name: Coffee
Coffee.description: Coffee should be made very weak. Instant coffee is not allowed.

Collard greens.name: Collard greens
Collard greens.description: Of the cabbage family introduce late in the diet

Cranberry juice.name: Cranberry juice
Cranberry juice.description: We use Knudsen’s Just Cranberry juice as it has been checked out and does not have sugar added. It can be found in most health food stores. Juice should be diluted with water before drinking. Since this is pure cranberry juice it is very tart you may sweeten it with saccharine or honey or dilute it with legal apple cider instead of water.

Cream.name: Cream
Cream.description: It is illegal as it contains lactose. Cream can be added to milk and then fermented to make SCD™24hr yoghurt as the lactose will be used up in the fermentation. Cream has less lactose than milk and the more fat it contains the less lactose it has.

Cyclamate.name: Cyclamate
Cyclamate.description: It is actually a better alternative than saccharine if you can get it because it has no aftertaste. But it's almost impossible to find by itself and certainly not available in NA.

Date sugar.name: Date sugar
Date sugar.description: May be tried after being on the diet for quite sometime and symptom free but it is not recommended.

Dates.name: Dates
Dates.description: Medjool and California dates are allowed. They must be loose and not have anything added.

Decaffeinated Products.name: Decaffeinated Products
Decaffeinated Products.description: Decaffeinated products are not legal since the manufacturing process may introduce questionable ingredients or reactions..

Dextrose (contained in commercial produc.name: Dextrose (contained in commercial products)
Dextrose (contained in commercial produc.description: The problem with the dextrose and fructose which is being sold as a granulated form as well as the dextrose contained in commercial products is that it is not pure dextrose which should be the same as the single sugar glucose found in fruits and honey.

Durum Flour.name: Durum Flour
Durum Flour.description: Its a type of wheat grain flour

Echinacea.name: Echinacea
Echinacea.description: Especially if it is in Alcohol but even it is in pill form with a bit of lactose. It can be very helpful if a cold or flu is coming on.

Ethanol.name: Ethanol
Ethanol.description: Ethanol is alcohol - the kind in gin, etc.

Ezekiel Bread.name: Ezekiel Bread
Ezekiel Bread.description: Has many Illegal ingredients Brown Rice Bran, FOS, Bifidus, flax seed

Feta Cheese.name: Feta Cheese
Feta Cheese.description: Feta may be used after about 6 months of improvement. But used only in small amounts.

Figs.name: Figs
Figs.description: Figs unpolluted by chemicals or additives are fine however I find them especially in dried form; to be a laxative. They also contain hundreds of tiny hard seeds which can be hard on the intestines. I'm still unable to tolerate them after almost a year on the SCD. If I were you I'd leave figs until you've been symptom free for at least a while. - Rob B

Filberts (hazelnuts).name: Filberts (hazelnuts)
Filberts (hazelnuts).description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour in recipes until diarrhea has subsided.

Fish.name: Fish
Fish.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

Flax seed.name: Flax seed
Flax seed.description: See Flax seed and flax seed oil within the Knowledge Base section: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/flax-seed-and-flax-seed-oil-/

Flax seed oil.name: Flax seed oil
Flax seed oil.description: See Flax seed and flax seed oil within the Knowledge Base section: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/flax-seed-and-flax-seed-oil-/

FOS.name: FOS
FOS.description: Also known as fructooligosaccharides. See FOS in the Knowledge Base section/.

Fowl.name: Fowl
Fowl.description: All types including turkey chicken duck goose pheasant

Orange Juice (concentrated).name: Orange Juice (concentrated)
Orange Juice (concentrated).description: If orange juice is just frozen and has no additives then it is legal however frozen orange juice is normally concentrated before freezing and the process to concentrate it makes it illegal see frozen orange juice processing

Fruits (canned).name: Fruits (canned)
Fruits (canned).description: Fruits canned in their own juice are allowed.

Garfava flour.name: Garfava flour
Garfava flour.description: Made from two types of beans Garbanzo beans and Fava beans neither are SCD™legal.

Garlic.name: Garlic
Garlic.description: Use fresh garlic; garlic powders have starch added as anti-caking agents. You may also make your own garlic powder from fresh garlic by dehydrating it and grinding it yourself.

Gelatin (unflavored).name: Gelatin (unflavored)
Gelatin (unflavored).description: It is a denatured protein that has lost its tertiary structure although it is not the best protein.

Glucose candy.name: Glucose candy
Glucose candy.description: Contains granulated glucose is known to contains other sugars in addition to glucose.

Glycerin.name: Glycerin
Glycerin.description: Since glycerin is not a sugar to begin with the "ol" at the end does not make it a sugar alcohol. Glycerin is considered to belong to the fat family. So does glycerol.

Glycerol.name: Glycerol
Glycerol.description: Since glycerin is not a sugar to begin with the "ol" at the end does not make it a sugar alcohol. Glycerin is considered to belong to the fat family. So does glycerol.

Goatein.name: Goatein
Goatein.description: It is a Protein powders that contains Bifidobacteria Bifidum. Protein Powders are a bad idea in any case as they're generally oxidized cholesterol - damaged by heat. - Deborah

Granulated glucose.name: Granulated glucose
Granulated glucose.description: It is known to contains other sugars in addition to glucose.

Grape juice.name: Grape juice
Grape juice.description: White or dark grape juice is allowed. We use Welch's bottled grape juice as it has been checked out and does not have sugar added. Avoid frozen grape juice it usually has sugar added. Juice should be diluted with water before drinking.

Grapefruit juice.name: Grapefruit juice
Grapefruit juice.description: Only legal if fresh. Frozen or canned grapefruit juice is not allowed. Juice should be diluted with water before drinking.

Ham.name: Ham
Ham.description: Only if cured with salt. it is illegal if cured with sugar dextrose etc. see Ham: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/ham/

Haricot beans.name: Haricot beans
Haricot beans.description: These are legal and are the same as navy beans. Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

Hazelnuts (filberts).name: Hazelnuts (filberts)
Hazelnuts (filberts).description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour in recipes until diarrhea has subsided.

Horseradish sauce.name: Horseradish sauce
Horseradish sauce.description: If homemade if manufactured only if you know they have not added illegals

Hot dogs.name: Hot dogs
Hot dogs.description: Commercially produced hotdogs will normally be illegal but here is a legal recipe on SCDiet by Marilyn: http://www.scdiet.net/marilyn%27s%20recipe%203.htm

Hydrolyzed Protein.name: Hydrolyzed Protein
Hydrolyzed Protein.description: This is another term for MSG. Regardless of whether it is SCD™ legal or not we should all try to avoid it. MSG can be a potent neurotoxin.

Ice cream.name: Ice cream
Ice cream.description: Commercially prepared ice cream is not allowed. However there are many wonderful recipes for homemade ice cream.

Inositol.name: Inositol
Inositol.description: Inositol is a sugar alcohol. Sugar alcohols will feed bacteria and that is something we do not want to do. Sugar alcohols generally cause diarrhea but small amounts in supplements are ok - Elaine

Inulin.name: Inulin
Inulin.description: Inulin is a FOS and is illegal see Inulin: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/inulin/

Iron supplements.name: Iron supplements
Iron supplements.description: Please do not get vitamins with iron; they encourage all kinds of infections especially in the gut and iron has had much research done on it re other diseases. No oral iron if you can help it. Just eat the liver pate and if you like liver, eat it at least once a week.

Isoglucose.name: Isoglucose
Isoglucose.description: It is a new sweetener likely to be used in many products in future. See Isoglucose: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge_base/detail/isoglucose/

Juice from concentrate.name: Juice from concentrate
Juice from concentrate.description: Juice from concentrate is normally illegal because when it is reconstituted they often add other things (like sugar). Often additives are not listed on the label

Ketchup.name: Ketchup
Ketchup.description: Commercially prepared ketchup contains sugar and is not allowed. See the gourmet section of the book Breaking the Vicious Cycle for a ketchup recipe.

Kidney beans.name: Kidney beans
Kidney beans.description: (All Types) May be tried when symptom free. Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

Konjac.name: Konjac
Konjac.description: Also called  konjaku konnyaku or the konnyaku potato or elephant yam. The dried corm of the konjac plant contains around 40% glucomannan gum. See Miracle Noodles.

Kudzu (or kuzu).name: Kudzu (or kuzu)
Kudzu (or kuzu).description: It is a mucilaginous herb. Mucilaginous herbs are loaded with starch. This starch is food for the pathogens that the SCD™ is designed to starve out.

L-Theanine.name: L-Theanine
L-Theanine.description: It is an amino acid as long as its pure without illegal binders etc its legal as with any new food go slow introducing it. - Seth

Lactaid Milk.name: Lactaid Milk
Lactaid Milk.description: The rate of flow of galactose to the liver when one drinks lactose hydrolyzed milk is high. With lactose hydrolyzed milk you are ingesting the two sugars: glucose and galactose at the same time. Note: Lactaid Milk is Lactose Hydrolyzed Milk

Lactose Hydrolyzed Milk.name: Lactose Hydrolyzed Milk
Lactose Hydrolyzed Milk.description: The rate of flow of galactose to the liver when one drinks lactose hydrolyzed milk is high. With lactose hydrolyzed milk you are ingesting the two sugars: glucose and galactose at the same time. Note: Lactaid Milk is Lactose Hydrolyzed Milk

Lamb.name: Lamb
Lamb.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

Lecithin.name: Lecithin
Lecithin.description: Derived from soy (illegal). There is plenty of good lecithin in egg yolks and Elaine sees no particular need to take it outside of a whole food.

Lentils.name: Lentils
Lentils.description: Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

Lettuce.name: Lettuce
Lettuce.description: All varieties of lettuce are legal.

Licorice.name: Licorice
Licorice.description: Licorice is both a demulcent and a laxative. For more info on demulcents see Licorice and Demulcents: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/demulcents/ http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/licorice/

Lignin.name: Lignin
Lignin.description: Grinding lignin and tough stuff does not prevent certain microorganisms from thanking you for chewing up their nutrition. The little buggers then respond by eating faster and making more babies and toxins.

Lima beans.name: Lima beans
Lima beans.description: Dried or fresh are permitted. Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

Macadamia oil.name: Macadamia oil
Macadamia oil.description: Makes the best tasting mayo - Deborah.  Withstands heat well

Maltitol.name: Maltitol
Maltitol.description: Sorbitol mannitol and xylitol are all sugar alcohols and are not SCD™ legal. They fall under the category of indigestible carbs and sugars and so allow companies to label things 'sugar free' even though they are providing nutrition to the bacteria that live in your digestive tract.

Maltodextrin.name: Maltodextrin
Maltodextrin.description: Maltodextrin is the worst of the small molecules of sugars. It is a very short chain of glucose molecules (derived from starch). The chances of digestion are practically nil. It therefore will feed bacteria and because of its particular structure Elaine feels it is worse than even lactose.

Mannitol.name: Mannitol
Mannitol.description: Sorbitol mannitol and xylitol are all sugar alcohols and are not SCD™ legal. They fall under the category of indigestible carbs and sugars and so allow companies to label things 'sugar free' even though they are providing nutrition to the bacteria that live in your digestive tract.

Mead.name: Mead
Mead.description: If homemade and ingredients are honey and yeast commercial is likely to have sugar added and is illegal

Meats.name: Meats
Meats.description: All fesh or frozen meats with no additives or processing are legal including beef, lamb, pork, liver and kidney

Meats (processed).name: Meats (processed)
Meats (processed).description: e.g. hot dogs, turkey loaf, spiced ham, bologna

Melatonin.name: Melatonin
Melatonin.description: Most have additives such as starch lactose and sugar

Milk.name: Milk
Milk.description: Fluid milk of any kind is not permitted.

MSG.name: MSG
MSG.description: Regardless of whether it is SCD™ legal or not we should all try to avoid it. MSG can be a potent neurotoxin.

Mucilaginous Herbs.name: Mucilaginous Herbs
Mucilaginous Herbs.description: Slimy mucilaginous substances are often prescribed as some think the "coating" properties are helpful to the intestines. They aren't. We who have compromised guts cannot digest this stuff but our bugs can have quite a party on it.

Mucilaginous Polysaccharides.name: Mucilaginous Polysaccharides
Mucilaginous Polysaccharides.description: Slimy mucilaginous substances are often prescribed as some think the "coating" properties are helpful to the intestines. They aren't. We who have compromised guts cannot digest this stuff but our bugs can have quite a party on it.

Mustard (plain).name: Mustard (plain)
Mustard (plain).description: Mustard is legal as long as it doesn't contain illegal ingredients; read the labels carefully.

Natural Flavors.name: Natural Flavors
Natural Flavors.description: Natural flavoring can be used to refer to anything including the chemicals coming from big "flavor" companies which sell chemicals to food processors.

Navy beans.name: Navy beans
Navy beans.description: Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

Nettles.name: Nettles
Nettles.description: Adverse effects from consuming nettle tea can range from upset stomach to burning sensations in the skin difficulty in urination and bloating.

Okra.name: Okra
Okra.description: No okra (bhindi) or drumsticks since they are a mucilaginous food they are illegal.

Olive oil.name: Olive oil
Olive oil.description: Olive oil withstands heat well good for frying, cooking and is highly recommended.

Olives.name: Olives
Olives.description: Olives are legal as long as they do not contain illegal ingredients; read the labels carefully.

Onions.name: Onions
Onions.description: Use fresh onions. Onion powders have starch added as anti-caking agents. You may also make your own onion powder from fresh onions by dehydrating them and grinding them yourself.

Orange juice.name: Orange juice
Orange juice.description: Fresh orange juice that does not have sugar added is allowed. While diarrhea is active avoid having orange juice in the morning. We use Tropicana's Original Orange Juice as it has been checked out and does not have sugar added.

Pappadum.name: Pappadum
Pappadum.description: They are an Indian snack made from lentils - they're like a chip. Also contains rice flour

Parsnips.name: Parsnips
Parsnips.description: At one time I had them included in my book but after getting feedback from the inflammatory bowel listserv I took them off. Some children do well with them; others do not. However they are pretty good from a carb standpoint and Dr. Haas allowed them. - Elaine

Pau 'Arco.name: Pau 'Arco
Pau 'Arco.description: Bark tea (Pau d'Arco) contains steroidal saponins and is both an immune booster and a laxative.

Peanut butter.name: Peanut butter
Peanut butter.description: Natural peanut butter with no sugar added is allowed.

Peanuts.name: Peanuts
Peanuts.description: Peanuts in the shell may be tried cautiously after 6 months on the diet if diarrhea is gone. Shelled peanuts are illegal. Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed as most are roasted with a starch coating.

Pecans.name: Pecans
Pecans.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour in recipes until diarrhea has subsided.

Pectin.name: Pectin
Pectin.description: It is a polysaccharide which in the presence of acid and sugar gels. It is used as a thickener in jams and occurs naturally in some fruit like apples.

Peppermint tea.name: Peppermint tea
Peppermint tea.description: Some brands out there put in natural flavourings which would make them illegal so check the ingredients carefully - Charlene

Peppers.name: Peppers
Peppers.description: Green, yellow and red peppers are permitted. Also jalapeno peppers, habanera peppers and chili peppers

Phosphatidylcholine.name: Phosphatidylcholine
Phosphatidylcholine.description: Another name for lecithin which is legal. Eggs have a huge amount of this but if you are not eating eggs perhaps a bit of supplement is fine. - Elaine

Pickles (dill).name: Pickles (dill)
Pickles (dill).description: Dill pickles are legal as long as they do not contain illegal ingredients; read the labels carefully. DILL PICKLES by Elaine Gottschall  http://www.scdiet.net/elainesrecipes.htm

Pine nuts.name: Pine nuts
Pine nuts.description: They are very hard to digest and even grinding them for pesto doesn't make them any easier on your gut. May be tried in small amounts after symptoms have subsided.

Pineapple juice.name: Pineapple juice
Pineapple juice.description: fall 2010 update: "The Dole 100% Pineapple juice in the can now adds Vitamins A, C and E. The Vitamin A is bound with cornstarch." old info: Fresh pineapple juice that does not have sugar added is allowed. We use Dole's unsweetened pineapple juice in the can, as it has been checked out and does not have sugar added. Juice should be diluted with water before drinking.

Pinto beans.name: Pinto beans
Pinto beans.description: Even after soaking they have the wrong kind of starch

Pistachio nuts.name: Pistachio nuts
Pistachio nuts.description: They are legal but the skins can be really tough for newbies. And don't get the pink dyed ones or the salted ones because they can have starch added to them. You can get unsalted unroasted pistachios at the health food store and then roast them yourself. For instructions see Pistachio Nuts: http://www.breakingtheviciouscycle.info/knowledge_base/detail/pistachio-nuts/

Pork.name: Pork
Pork.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

Pork Rinds.name: Pork Rinds
Pork Rinds.description: Use the plain pork rinds with no added flavourings and check the label carefully to make sure they don't contain illegal ingredients

Potatoes.name: Potatoes
Potatoes.description: Both white and sweet potatoes are illegal.

Poultry.name: Poultry
Poultry.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

Processed cheeses.name: Processed cheeses
Processed cheeses.description: See the appendix of the book Breaking the Vicious Cycle for a complete list of illegal cheeses.

Provolone cheese.name: Provolone cheese
Provolone cheese.description: Although not listed with the other cheeses on page 140 of Breaking the Vicious Cycle provolone cheese is legal.

Psyllium husks.name: Psyllium husks
Psyllium husks.description: They are loaded with cellulose and lignin which some bacteria thrive on. We accept that the cellulose in vegetables and fruit can be handled OK but a concentrated form such as husks would not be in order.

Pumpkin.name: Pumpkin
Pumpkin.description: Fresh pumpkin is legal, canned pumpkin is not allowed. Butternut squash may be used as a substitute for pumpkin in baking.

Pumpkin (canned).name: Pumpkin (canned)
Pumpkin (canned).description: Canned pumpkin is illegal. Butternut squash may be substituted for pumpkin in baking.

Quinoa.name: Quinoa
Quinoa.description: Since Quinoa is 60% starch it is very illegal.

Rice.name: Rice
Rice.description: Both brown and white rice are illegal.

Rice Bran.name: Rice Bran
Rice Bran.description: Except as a supplement filler as it is mainly oil. If one is taking a supplement which has proven to be efficacious then the small amount of filler within the supplement will probably not have an adverse effect. - Elaine.

Rutabaga.name: Rutabaga
Rutabaga.description: Also known as swede It is very fibrous so go slow and be careful.

Tabasco sauce.name: Tabasco sauce
Tabasco sauce.description: Only the original red Tabasco sauce, labeled "McIlhenny Company Tabasco Brand Pepper Sauce" is legal but as with all manufactured products check the ingredients. The other Tabasco styles all have sugars and gums added.

Tapioca.name: Tapioca
Tapioca.description: It is a starch, therefore illegal.

Taro.name: Taro
Taro.description: It has much too much starch in it and is very similar to potatoes.

Tea.name: Tea
Tea.description:
Ordinary black tea is legal but should be made weak.
Instant tea,Ojibwa tea (Essiac), many herbal teas, teas made from bark etc are full of polysaccharides and are illegal. Peppermint and spearmint herb teas are legal, and you can make a tea from ginger which is also legal.

Tomato juice (canned).name: Tomato juice (canned)
Tomato juice (canned).description: Should only have salt added. Also see Tomato Juice - canned http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/tomato-juice-canned/

Turbinado.name: Turbinado
Turbinado.description: It is liquid cane sugar, therefore it is illegal.

Turnips.name: Turnips
Turnips.description: In the most recent printing of BTVC (Ninth Printing - May 2002), turnips were moved from the 'allowed' list to the 'not allowed' list.

V8 Juice.name: V8 Juice
V8 Juice.description: It has tomato paste listed as an ingredient. Elaine has listed tomato paste as being illegal. It is also made from concentrate and has added sugar.

Vanillin.name: Vanillin
Vanillin.description: But not in concentrated form see Vanillin http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/vanillin/

Vegetable stearate.name: Vegetable stearate
Vegetable stearate.description: I believe that stearate is always a fat (stearic acid) so vegetable stearate would be a fat from some vegetable like coconut, etc. -- Elaine

Vegetables (canned).name: Vegetables (canned)
Vegetables (canned).description: Canned vegetables are not permitted; they must either be fresh or frozen.

Vinegar.name: Vinegar
Vinegar.description: Red and white wine vinegar also white and cider vinegars are allowed but check the label for added illegals. Balsamic vinegar is not allowed as it has added sugar. However you can make your own legal balsamic vinegar substitute see scdrecipe http://www.scdrecipe.com/recipes/

Sake.name: Sake
Sake.description: It is not a distilled spirit like Vodka and it is the distillation that removes the illegals - Seth Both sweet and dry sake still have sugar and actually the dry sake has more sugar than the sweet sake but you can't taste it because of the acidity. - Kim

Salt.name: Salt
Salt.description: Ordinary iodized table salt, altho it sometimes has dextrose, is legal because it is important to get that iodine

Sashimi.name: Sashimi
Sashimi.description: (Japanese sushi-style raw fish served all by itself w/o rice)

Seaweed.name: Seaweed
Seaweed.description: Seaweed is high in polysaccharides and therefore illegal.

Seed Flour.name: Seed Flour
Seed Flour.description: It is not allowed because the quantity of the flour way surpasses the few seeds that Elaine had in mind when she said "seeds are permissible after 3 months of no symptoms."

Seeds.name: Seeds
Seeds.description: Permissible after 3 months of no symptoms.

Sharifa.name: Sharifa
Sharifa.description: Also known as custard apple or cherimoya

Shellfish.name: Shellfish
Shellfish.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

Slippery elm.name: Slippery elm
Slippery elm.description: It is a mucilaginous herb. Mucilaginous herbs are loaded with starch. This starch is food for the pathogens that the SCD™ is designed to starve out.

Smoked meats.name: Smoked meats
Smoked meats.description: Unless you know with certainty that no sugar has been added during the smoking process, they are not permitted.

Sorbitol.name: Sorbitol
Sorbitol.description: Sorbitol, mannitol, and xylitol are all sugar alcohols and are not SCD™ legal. They fall under the category of indigestible carbs and sugars, and so allow companies to label things 'sugar free', even though they are providing nutrition to the bacteria that live in your digestive tract.

Soy Lecithin.name: Soy Lecithin
Soy Lecithin.description: Derived from soy (illegal). There is plenty of good lecithin in egg yolks, and Elaine sees no particular need to take it outside of a whole food. Also see Carlsons fish oil: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/carlsons-fish-oil/

Soy Sauce.name: Soy Sauce
Soy Sauce.description: Soy sauce is a fermented soy product and also contains wheat so it is illegal.

Spices.name: Spices
Spices.description: Spices of all kinds may be used, but avoid spice mixtures; buy spices separately.

Spirulina.name: Spirulina
Spirulina.description: We do not use algae (Spirulina) because IBD involves the immune system and can aggravate an already disturbed immune system.

Splenda.name: Splenda
Splenda.description: There are several reasons why it is illegal, see Splenda: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/splenda/

Split peas.name: Split peas
Split peas.description: Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

Squash.name: Squash
Squash.description: Both winter and summer squashes are legal.

Stevia.name: Stevia
Stevia.description: Its molecular structure resembles a steroid and the effects are unknown. See, Stevia: http://www.breakingtheviciouscycle.info/knowledge_base/detail/stevia/

Sucralose.name: Sucralose
Sucralose.description: There are several reasons why it is illegal, see Splenda: http://www.breakingtheviciouscycle.info/knowledge_base/detail/splenda/

Sulphites.name: Sulphites
Sulphites.description: When a fruit such as peaches (dried) and coconut is sulphated, it means it has been exposed to sulphur to keep the color from darkening. Some people are allergic to sulphated products but most of us are not bothered by them.

xylitol.name: xylitol
xylitol.description: Sorbitol, mannitol, and xylitol are all sugar alcohols and are not SCD™ legal. They fall under the category of indigestible carbs and sugars, and so allow companies to label things 'sugar free', even though they are providing nutrition to the bacteria that live in your digestive tract.

Yoghurt (commercial).name: Yoghurt (commercial)
Yoghurt (commercial).description:
Eating commercial yoghurt is not permitted. Commercial yoghurt may be used as a starter for making homemade yogurt. For directions for making yoghurt
see, See Commercial Yoghurt

Yoghurt (homemade).name: Yoghurt (homemade)
Yoghurt (homemade).description: See, yoghurt in the Knowledge Base section for instructions on how to make legal yoghurt.

Walnuts.name: Walnuts
Walnuts.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour in recipes until diarrhea has subsided.

Wasabi.name: Wasabi
Wasabi.description: As long as it is in its natural state and hasn't had fillers added by a manufacturer

Wine.name: Wine
Wine.description: Very dry wine is legal. See Wines for more information on dry wines.

levä.name: levä
levä.description: Emme käytä leviä (Spirulina) koska IBD vaikuttaa immuunijärjestelmään ja levät voivat pahentaa jo häiriintynyttä immuunijärjestelmää.

Maustepippuri.name: Maustepippuri
Maustepippuri.description: Kunhan et vain käyttämällä maustepippuri Keittokemikaalina mauste se on laillista. Älä käytä öljyä katso Allspice

mantelimaito.name: mantelimaito
mantelimaito.description: Kokeilu sallittu kun henkilö noudattanut ruokavaliota 6 kuukautta.

Amaranth jauho.name: Amaranth jauho
Amaranth jauho.description: Amaranth on viljan korvike ja sisältää tärkkelystä, joten se ei ole sallittua.

Artisokka (ranska).name: Artisokka (ranska)
Artisokka (ranska).description: Ne ovat vihreitä artisokat että olet höyryä sitten pulahtaa lehdet sitruuna voin ja kaavi pois hampaita. Heillä on syötävä sydämet ja syötäväksi kelpaamattomat kuristimen.

Artisokka (Jerusalem).name: Artisokka (Jerusalem)
Artisokka (Jerusalem).description: Kyseessä on mukula, ja ne eivät ole sallittuja

Parsa.name: Parsa
Parsa.description: Laillinen tuoreena tai pakastettuna. Tölkitettyjä vihanneksia ei sallita.

aspartaami.name: aspartaami
aspartaami.description: Kun oire vapaa, yksi aspartaami pitoinen juoma sallitaan viikossa - Elaine. Mutta katso Aspartaami tietopankista ensin: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/aspartame/

avokadoöljy.name: avokadoöljy
avokadoöljy.description: Hyvä majoneeseja ja salaattikastikkeita varten, mutta ei kestä hyvin lämpöä.

Pekoni.name: Pekoni
Pekoni.description: Savustettu pekoni, joka on kypsennetty hyvin rapeaksi on sallittu kerran viikossa. Sokeritonta pekonia on olemassa, ja jos löydät sokeritonta pekonia, sinun ei tarvitse rajoittaa kulutusta kerran viikkoon. Yleensä vähä-suolaiset vaihtoehdot eivät sisällä sokeria, mutta katso tuoteselosteet tarkasti.

leivinhiiva.name: leivinhiiva
leivinhiiva.description: Saccharomyces cerevisiae on leivontahiiva ja on laitonta.

Leivinjauhe.name: Leivinjauhe
Leivinjauhe.description: Sisältää tärkkelystä (useimmiten maissitärkkelys) ja muita laittomia aineita.

banaani.name: banaani
banaani.description: Oltava niin kypsiä että mustia pilkkuja on ilmestynyt kuoreen.

papujauhot.name: papujauhot
papujauhot.description: Älä käytä valmiiksi tehtyjä papu tai linssijauhoja, koska niitä ei todennäköisesti liuotettu ennen jauhoksi jauhamista.

Siitepöly.name: Siitepöly
Siitepöly.description: Siitepöly ärsyttää vahingoittunutta ruuansulatusta. Puhdas, kirkas ja pastöroitu hunaja on ok. Sameaa hunajaa (joka sisältää edelleen siitepölyä) tulisi välttää - Sheila

naudanliha.name: naudanliha
naudanliha.description: Tuore ja pakastettu on sallittua, kunhan mitään ei ole lisätty prosessoinnin aikana. Tarkista tuoteselosteet tarkasti.

musta papu.name: musta papu
musta papu.description: Voidaan kokeilla, kun ei ole oireita. Kuivatut palkokasvit tulee valmistaa Breaking the Vicious Cycle kirjan ohjeiden mukaisesti.

Retikka.name: Retikka
Retikka.description: Sisältää paljon kuitua joten kokeiltava varovaisesti.

pinaattikiinankaali.name: pinaattikiinankaali
pinaattikiinankaali.description: Pinaattikiinankaali on kuin kaali ja on laillista, mutta sinun ei tulisi käyttää kaalin sukuun kuuluvaa vihannesta, ennen kuin voit jo selkeästi paremmin. Toisinsanoen älä käytä jos sinulla on edelleen ripulia ja kaasua.

Liemikuutiot.name: Liemikuutiot
Liemikuutiot.description: Liemikuutiot ja instat keitto jauheet eivät ole sallittuja.

Kaali.name: Kaali
Kaali.description: Sinun ei tulisi käyttää kaalin sukuun kuuluvaa vihannesta, ennen kuin voit jo selkeästi paremmin. Toisinsanoen älä käytä jos sinulla on edelleen ripulia ja kaasua.

Kalasäilykkeet.name: Kalasäilykkeet
Kalasäilykkeet.description: Öljyssä tai vedessä purkitetut ovat laillisia, mutta tarkasta tuoteselosteet tarkasti.

säilykehedelmät.name: säilykehedelmät
säilykehedelmät.description: Hedelmät jotka on purkitettu omassa mehussa ovat sallittuja.

karrageeni.name: karrageeni
karrageeni.description: Karrageeni on merilevä ja sisältää paljon polysakkarideja, joten on siis laiton.

Kukkakaali.name: Kukkakaali
Kukkakaali.description: Kukkakaali on joskus hankala ruuansulatukselle ja sitä tulisi kokeilla varovaisesti, vasta kun edistystä on ollut havaittavissa ruokavaliolla.

Mukulaselleri.name: Mukulaselleri
Mukulaselleri.description: Hyvin kuituinen, vaikka ei välttämättä vaikuta siltä. Kokeile varovaisesti ja pienissä määrissä.

Sellerin juuri.name: Sellerin juuri
Sellerin juuri.description: Hyvin kuituinen, vaikka ei välttämättä vaikuta siltä. Kokeile varovaisesti ja pienissä määrissä.

Selluloosa (lisäravinteissa).name: Selluloosa (lisäravinteissa)
Selluloosa (lisäravinteissa).description: Selluloosa lisäravinteissa on sallittua ja käytännössä mahdotonta välttää.

Lehtimangoldi.name: Lehtimangoldi
Lehtimangoldi.description: Lehtimangoldi muistuttaa pinaattia ja selleriä joten on laillinen. Se muistuttaa minua myös hieman kaali vihannesten edustajista, joten käytä varoen jos turvotus on vielä ongelma. - Elaine

kirimoija.name: kirimoija
kirimoija.description: Tunnetaan myös nimellä annoona tai Sharifa.

kastanjat.name: kastanjat
kastanjat.description: Voidaan kokeilla kun oireita ei enää ole. Jos ostat kuivia kastanjoita, liuota ja kypsennä ne ensin pehmeiksi.

Chevre-juusto.name: Chevre-juusto
Chevre-juusto.description: Chevre-juusto on laitonta, mutta voit seuraavaa ohjetta seuraamalla tehdä vastaavaa juustoa: http://uclbs.org/recipes/dairy/suegoatcheese.php

Purukumi.name: Purukumi
Purukumi.description: Saattaa sisältää laittomia sokerin korvikkeita, kuten aspartaamia ja ksylitolia

sikurijuuri.name: sikurijuuri
sikurijuuri.description: Sikurijuuri ei ole laillista. Ensimmäisessä kirjassani ehdotin että sitä voitaisiin käyttää kahvipapujen sijaan. Sitemmin olen oppinut että ne sisältävät runsaasti frukto-oligosakkarideja.

Suklaa.name: Suklaa
Suklaa.description: Dr. Haas on neuvonut olemaan käyttämättä suklaata tai kaakaota, eikä hän ole huolestunut vain sokerista.

Kaakaojauhe.name: Kaakaojauhe
Kaakaojauhe.description: Dr. Haas neuvoi olemaan käyttämättä kaakaota tai suklaata, ja se pitää edelleen paikkaansa. Hän ei ollut huolestunut vain näiden sisältämästä sokerista.

kookospähkinä.name: kookospähkinä
kookospähkinä.description: Tuore ja makeuttamaton kookoshiutale ja kookosjauho ovat laillisia

Kookosmaito.name: Kookosmaito
Kookosmaito.description: Voidaan kokeilla kun henkilö on ollut ruokavaliolla 6 kuukautta.

Kookosöljy.name: Kookosöljy
Kookosöljy.description: Kestää kuumuutta hyvin ja on hyvä paistamiseen ja ruoanlaittoon.

kahvi.name: kahvi
kahvi.description: Kahvista tulisi tehdä hyvin laimeaa. Pikakahvi ei ole sallittu.

Rehuydinkaali.name: Rehuydinkaali
Rehuydinkaali.description: Kuuluu kaaleihin joten esitellään myöhään ruokavaliossa.

Kerma.name: Kerma
Kerma.description: Se on laitonta sillä sisältää laktoosia. Kermaa voidaan lisätä maitoon, SCD™ 24h jogurtin valmistamista varten, sillä laktoosi pilkkoutuu happatamisen aikana. Kermassa on vähemmän laktoosia kuin maidossa, ja mitä enemmän siinä on rasvaa sitä vähemmän siinä on laktoosia.

taatelisokeri.name: taatelisokeri
taatelisokeri.description: Voidaan kokeilla kun henkilö on ollut ruokavaliolla jonkin aikaa ja hänellä ei ole oireita, mutta ei ole suositeltavaa.

taateli.name: taateli
taateli.description: Medjool- ja California-taatelit ovat sallittuja. Niiden täytyy olla ilmavasti pakkattuja ja niissä ei saa olla mitään lisättyä.

kofeiinittomat Tuotteet.name: kofeiinittomat Tuotteet
kofeiinittomat Tuotteet.description: Kofeiinittomat tuotteet eivät ole laillisia sillä tuotantopressissa niihin on voitu lisätä kyseenalaisia ainesosia tai ovat käyneet läpi haitallisia reaktioita.

etanoli.name: etanoli
etanoli.description: Etanoli on alkoholi, jota löytyy esim ginistä, vodkasta yms.

Ezekiel Leipä.name: Ezekiel Leipä
Ezekiel Leipä.description: Sisältää lukuisia laittomia ainesosia kuten riisilese, FOS, Bifidus ja pellavansiemen.

Fetajuusto.name: Fetajuusto
Fetajuusto.description: Fetaa saa käyttää kun oireet ovat olleet poissa 6 kuukauden ajan, mutta vain pienissä määrissä.

hasselpähkinä.name: hasselpähkinä
hasselpähkinä.description: Pähkinöitä tulisi käyttää vain jauhoina ruuanlaitossa, kunnes ripuli on hellittänyt.

kala.name: kala
kala.description: Tuore ja pakastettu sallitaan, kunhan prosessoinnin aikana ei ole lisätty mitään. Lue tuoteselosteet huolella.

FOS.name: FOS
FOS.description: Tunnetaan myös nimellä frukto-oligosakkaridi. Katso FOS "Knowledge Base" osiosta.

riistalintu.name: riistalintu
riistalintu.description: Kaikki lajit ovat sallittuja kuten kalkkuna, kana, ankka, hanhi ja fasaani.

hedelmäsäilykkeet.name: hedelmäsäilykkeet
hedelmäsäilykkeet.description: Hedelmät jotka on purkitettu omassa mehussa ovat sallittuja.

Garfava jauhot.name: Garfava jauhot
Garfava jauhot.description: Valmistettu Garbanzo ja Fava pavuista, kumpikaan ei ole laillinen.

Valkosipuli.name: Valkosipuli
Valkosipuli.description: Käytä tuoretta valkosipulia. Valkosipulijauheissa on usein tärkkelystä lisättynä paakkuuntumisenestoaineena. Voit tehdä myös omaa valkosipulijauhetta, kuivattamalla ja jauhamalla tuoretta valkosipulia.

Gelatiini (maustamaton).name: Gelatiini (maustamaton)
Gelatiini (maustamaton).description: Kyseessä on denaturoitu proteiini, joka on menettänyt tertiäärisen rakenteensa. Ei ole kovin hyvä proteiininlähde.

glukoosi.name: glukoosi
glukoosi.description: Sisältää usein muitakin sokereita kuin vain glukoosia.

greippimehu (sokeroimaton).name: greippimehu (sokeroimaton)
greippimehu (sokeroimaton).description: Ainoastaan laillinen tuoreena. Pakastettuna tai purkitettuna ei ole laillista. Mehu tulisi laimentaa ennen juomista.

kinkku (prosessoimaton).name: kinkku (prosessoimaton)
kinkku (prosessoimaton).description: Laillista vain jos käsitelty vain suolalla. Jos sisältää sokeria ei ole laillinen: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/ham/

Valkoinen papu.name: Valkoinen papu
Valkoinen papu.description: Kuivatut palkokasvit tulee valmistaa Breaking the Vicious Cycle kirjan ohjeiden mukaan.

Hasselpähkinä.name: Hasselpähkinä
Hasselpähkinä.description: Pähkinöitä tulisi käyttää vain jauhoina ruuanlaitossa, kunnes ripuli on hellittänyt.

hot dog.name: hot dog
hot dog.description: Kaupallisesti tuotetut hot dogit ovat yleensä laittomia, mutta tässä Marilynin laillinen resepti: http://www.scdiet.net/marilyn%27s%20recipe%203.htm

jäätelö.name: jäätelö
jäätelö.description: Teollisesti valmistetut jäätelöt eivät ole laillisia. Kuitenkin on olemassa lukuisia hyviä kotitekoisia jäätelöreseptejä.

inuliini.name: inuliini
inuliini.description: Inuulini on frukto-oligosakkaridi ja on laiton. Katso inuliini: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/inulin/

rautalisät.name: rautalisät
rautalisät.description: Älä käytä vitamiineja joissa on rautaa. Ne aiheuttavat infektioita etenkin ruuansulatus elimissä. Älä ota suullista, rautaa jos vain pystyt. Syö maksa pateeta ja jos pidät maksasta, syö sitä vähintään kerran viikossa.

isoglukoosia.name: isoglukoosia
isoglukoosia.description: Se on uusi makeutusaine. Katso isoglukoosi: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge_base/detail/isoglucose/

mehutiiviste.name: mehutiiviste
mehutiiviste.description: Mehu tiivisteestä on yleensä laitonta, koska siihen on usein lisätty sokeria.

Ketsuppi.name: Ketsuppi
Ketsuppi.description: Kaupallisesti valmistettu ketsuppi sisältää sokeria ja ei ole sallittua. Ketsuppi resepti löytyy Breaking the Vicious Cycle kirjan gourmet osasta.

Kidney-pavut.name: Kidney-pavut
Kidney-pavut.description: Kaikkia tyyppejä voidaan kokeilla kun oireita ei enää ole. Kuivatut palkokasvit tulee valmistaa Breaking the Vicious Cycle kirjan ohjeiden mukaisesti.

L-Teaniini.name: L-Teaniini
L-Teaniini.description: Se on aminohappo ja kunhan se on puhtaassa muodossa ilman laittomia lisäaineita se on laillinen. Kuten kaikkin uusien aineiden kanssa, aloita varovasti. -Seth (vapaasti käännetty englannista)

lammas.name: lammas
lammas.description: Tuore ja pakastettu ovat laillisia kunhan mitään ei ole lisätty prosessoinnin aikana. Tarkista tuoteselosteet tarkasti.

lesitiini.name: lesitiini
lesitiini.description: Johdettu soijasta (laiton). Kananmunissa on paljon hyvää lesitiiniä ja Elaine ei näe mitään syytä miksi lesitiiniä pitäisi käyttää lisäravinteena.

linssit.name: linssit
linssit.description: Kuivatut palkokasvit tulee valmista Breaking the Vicious Cycle kirjan mukaisesti.

Lakritsi.name: Lakritsi
Lakritsi.description: Lakritsi on "demulcent" ja laksatiivi. Katso demulcent ja lakritsi: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/demulcents/ http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/licorice/

ligniini.name: ligniini
ligniini.description: Ligniinin jauhaminen ei estä tiettyjä mikro-organismeja käyttämästä sitä ravinnokseen. Päinvastoin ligniinin jauhaminen saattaa nopeuttaa mikro-organismien lisääntymistä.

Limanpapu.name: Limanpapu
Limanpapu.description: Kuivatut ja tuoreet ovat sallittuja. Kuivatut palkokasvit täytyy valmistaa Breaking the Vicious Cycle kirjan ohjeiden mukaisesti.

Voipapu.name: Voipapu
Voipapu.description: Kuivatut ja tuoreet ovat sallittuja. Kuivatut palkokasvit täytyy valmistaa Breaking the Vicious Cycle kirjan ohjeiden mukaisesti.

Macadamiapähkinät.name: Macadamiapähkinät
Macadamiapähkinät.description: Pähkinöitä tulisi käyttää vain jauhoina ruuanlaitossa, kunnes ripuli on hellittänyt.

maltitoli.name: maltitoli
maltitoli.description: Sorbitoli, mannitoli ja ksylitoli ovat kaikki sokerialkoholeja ja eivät ole SCD™ ruokavalion mukaan laillisia. Ne ovat sokereita joita ihmisen keho ei pysty käsittelemään. Usein niin sanotut sokerittomat tuotteet sisältävät näitä, ja nämä sokerit ruokkivat ruuansulatuksen bakteereja.

maltodekstriini.name: maltodekstriini
maltodekstriini.description: Maltodesktriini on pahin pieni molekyylisistä sokereista. Se koostuu hyvin lyhyestä glukoosi ketjusta (valmistettu tärkkelyksestä). Mahdollisuudet sen sulattamiseen ovat käytännössä olemattomat. Sen tuloksena se ruokkii bakteereja, ja sen rakenteen vuoksi Elainen mielestä se on pahempi kuin laktoosi.

mannitoli.name: mannitoli
mannitoli.description: Sorbitoli, mannitoli ja ksylitoli ovat kaikki sokerialkoholeja ja eivät ole SCD™ ruokavalion mukaan laillisia. Ne ovat sokereita joita ihmisen keho ei pysty käsittelemään. Usein niin sanotut sokerittomat tuotteet sisältävät näitä, ja nämä sokerit ruokkivat ruuansulatuksen bakteereja.

Lihat.name: Lihat
Lihat.description: Kaikki tuoreet ja pakastetut lihat ovat laillisia, kunhan niissä ei ole lisäaineita tai niitä ei ole prosessoitu. Laillisia ovat esimerkiksi, nauta, sika, maksa ja munuainen.

Melatoniini.name: Melatoniini
Melatoniini.description: Suurimmassa osassa on lisäaineita kuten tärkkelystä, laktoosia ja sokeria

Natriumglutamaatti.name: Natriumglutamaatti
Natriumglutamaatti.description: Riipumatta siitä onko se SCD™ laillista vai ei, meidän tulisi yrittää välttää sitä. Natriumgliutamaatti voi olla vahva neuromyrkky.

luontaiset aromit.name: luontaiset aromit
luontaiset aromit.description: Luonnolliset aromit voi viitata mihin tahansa.

nokkonen.name: nokkonen
nokkonen.description: Nokkosteen haittavaikutukset voivat vaihdella vatsavaivoista polttavaan sensaatioon iholla, sekä virtsausvaikeuksiin ja turvotukseen.

Oliiviöljy.name: Oliiviöljy
Oliiviöljy.description: Oliiviöljy kestää hyvin lämpöä, on hyvä paistamiseen ja muutenkin hyvin suositeltu.

oliivi.name: oliivi
oliivi.description: Oliivit ovat laillisia, kunhan ne eivät sisällä laittomia ainesosia; Lue tuoteselosteet huolellisesti.

sipuli.name: sipuli
sipuli.description: Käytä tuoretta sipulia. Sipulijauheissa on usein tärkkelystä lisättynä paakkuuntumisenestoaineena. Voit myös tehdä sipulijauhetta itse tuoreista sipuleista, kuivattamalla ja jauhamalla ne.

appelsiinimehu.name: appelsiinimehu
appelsiinimehu.description: Tuore appelsiinimehu, jossa ei ole sokeria lisättynä on laillista. Jos sinulla on vielä ripulia vältä appelsiinimehua aamuisin.

Papadum.name: Papadum
Papadum.description: Papadum on Intialainen herkku, joka on tehty linsseistä. Ne ovat sipsimäisiä, ja sisältävät usein riisijauhoa.

Paprika.name: Paprika
Paprika.description: Vihreä, keltainen ja punainen paprika ovat sallittuja. Myös jalopeno, habanero ja chili.

palsternakka.name: palsternakka
palsternakka.description: Yhdessä vaiheessa ne olivat sisällytettynä kirjaani, mutta sain palautetta IBD potilailta ja otin ne pois. Jotkut lapset sietävät niitä hyvin, ja jotkut eivät. Toisaalta ne ovat melko hyviä hiilihydraatti lähteitä ja Dr. Haas on sallinut ne. -Elaine

Maapähkinävoi.name: Maapähkinävoi
Maapähkinävoi.description: Luonnollinen maapähkinävoi ilman sokeria on sallittu.

maapähkinät.name: maapähkinät
maapähkinät.description: Maapähkinöitä voi kokeilla varovaisesti kun on ollut SCD ruokavaliolla kuusi kuukautta, jos ripuli on lakannut.

herne.name: herne
herne.description: Kuivatut palkokasvit tulee valmistaa Breaking the Vicious Cycle kirjan ohjeiden mukaisesti.

pekaanipähkinä.name: pekaanipähkinä
pekaanipähkinä.description: Pähkinöitä tulisi käyttää vain pähkinäjauhoina eri resepetissä, kunnes ripuli on hellittänyt.

pektiini.name: pektiini
pektiini.description: Se on polysakkaridi joka hapon ja sokerin läsnäollessa hyytelöityy. Sitä käytetään suurusteena hilloissa ja sitä esiintyy luonnostaan joissain hedelmissä kuten omenoissa.

piparminttutee.name: piparminttutee
piparminttutee.description: Jotkut merkit sisältävät luonnollisia aromeja, joten tarkista tuoteselosteet tarkasti. -Charlene

fosfatidyylikoliini.name: fosfatidyylikoliini
fosfatidyylikoliini.description: Toinen nimi lesitiinillä, joka on laillista. Fosfatidyylikoliinia on runsaasti kananmunissa, mutta jos et syö kananmunia ehkä pieni määrä lisäravinteena on ok. - Elaine (vapaasti käännetty Englannista)

Suolakurkku (tilli).name: Suolakurkku (tilli)
Suolakurkku (tilli).description: Tilli suolakurkut ovat laillisia, kunhan niissä ei ole laittomia ainesosia. Lue tuoteselosteet tarkasti! Katso Elaine Gottschallin suolakurkku resepti linkin takaa: http://www.scdiet.net/elainesrecipes.htm

pinjansiemen.name: pinjansiemen
pinjansiemen.description: Ovat hyvin hankalia ruuansulatukselle ja edes niiden jauhaminen pestoksi ei tee niistä helpompia ruuansulatukselle. Voidaan kokeilla hyvin pienissä määrissä jahka oireet ovat hellittäneet.

Pinto pavut.name: Pinto pavut
Pinto pavut.description: Sisältävät haitallisia tärkkelyksiä jopa liuottamisen jälkeen.

pistaasipähkinä.name: pistaasipähkinä
pistaasipähkinä.description: Laillisia. Voit ostaa suolaamattomia ja paahtamattomia pistaasipähkinöitä ja paahtaa ne itse. Ohjeita varten avaa linkki: http://www.breakingtheviciouscycle.info/knowledge_base/detail/pistachio-nuts/

sianliha.name: sianliha
sianliha.description: Tuore ja pakastettu on laillista, kunhan mitään ei ole lisätty prosessoinnin aikana. Tarkista tuoteseloste huolella.

Kamara.name: Kamara
Kamara.description: Varmista että tuotteessa ei ole lisäaineita. Lue tuoteseloste huolella.

peruna.name: peruna
peruna.description: Sekä tavalliset perunat että bataatit ovat laittomia.

Siipikarja.name: Siipikarja
Siipikarja.description: Tuore ja pakastettu siipikarja on laillista, kunhan mitään ei ole lisätty proessoinnin aikana. Tarkista etiketit huolellisesti.

sulatejuusto.name: sulatejuusto
sulatejuusto.description: Katso kirjasta Breaking the Vicious Cycle liite, joka sisältää täydellisen listan laittomista juustoista.

Provolone-juusto.name: Provolone-juusto
Provolone-juusto.description: Vaikka sitä ei ole listattu muiden juustojen joukossa sivulla 140 Breaking the Vicious Cycle kirjassa, provolone-juusto on laillista.

psylliumin kuoret.name: psylliumin kuoret
psylliumin kuoret.description: Sisältävät runsaasti selluloosaa ja ligniiniä, joiden avulla tietyt bakteerit lisääntyvät runsaasti. Selluloosa vihanneksista ja hedelmistä on vielä siedettävää, mutta tiivistetyssä muodossa, kuten kuorina, se ei ole suositeltavaa.

Kurpitsa.name: Kurpitsa
Kurpitsa.description: Tuore kurpitsa on laillista, ja purkitettu kurpitsa on kielletty. Myskikurpitsaa voidaan käyttää kurpitsan korvikkeena leivonnassa.

Kurpitsa (säilyke).name: Kurpitsa (säilyke)
Kurpitsa (säilyke).description: Purkitettu kurpitsa on laitonta. Myskikurpitsaa voidaan käyttää kurpitsan sijasta leivonnassa.

Kvinoa.name: Kvinoa
Kvinoa.description: Koska Kvinoa on 60% tärkkelystä, se on erittäin laitonta.

Riisi.name: Riisi
Riisi.description: Sekä ruskea että valkoinen riisi ovat laittomia.

Taro.name: Taro
Taro.description: Sisältää aivan liikaa tärkkelystä ja muistuttaa paljon perunaa.

Tomaattimehu (säilyke).name: Tomaattimehu (säilyke)
Tomaattimehu (säilyke).description: Ainoa lisätty aineosa tulisi olla suola. Katso tomaattimehu - purkitettu: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/tomato-juice-canned/

täysruokosokeri.name: täysruokosokeri
täysruokosokeri.description: Se on nestemäinen ruokosokeri, joten se on laitonta.

vanilja.name: vanilja
vanilja.description: Mutta ei tiivistetyssä muodossa. Katso Vanilliini http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/vanillin/

Kasvikset (purkitettu).name: Kasvikset (purkitettu)
Kasvikset (purkitettu).description: Säilötyt vihannekset eivät ole sallittuja; niiden täytyy olla joka tuoreita tai pakastettuja.

sashimi.name: sashimi
sashimi.description: Raakaa kalaa valmistettuna japanilaiseen tyyliin. Tarjoillaan sellaisenaan, mutta ilman riisiä.

merilevä.name: merilevä
merilevä.description: Levää sisältävät runsaasti polysakkarideja ja ovat siten laittomia.

äyriäiset.name: äyriäiset
äyriäiset.description: Tuoreet ja pakastetut ovat laillisia, kunhan mitään ei ole lisätty prosessoinnin aikana. Tarkista tuoteselosteet tarkasti.

Savustettu liha.name: Savustettu liha
Savustettu liha.description: Jos tiedät varmasti että sokeria ei ole lisätty savustusprosessin aikana, savustettu liha on laillista.

sorbitoli.name: sorbitoli
sorbitoli.description: Sorbitoli, mannitoli ja ksylitoli ovat kaikki sokerialkoholeja ja eivät ole SCD™ ruokavalion mukaan laillisia. Ne ovat sokereita joita ihmisen keho ei pysty käsittelemään. Usein niin sanotut sokerittomat tuotteet sisältävät näitä, ja nämä sokerit ruokkivat ruuansulatuksen bakteereja.

Soijalesitiini.name: Soijalesitiini
Soijalesitiini.description: Valmistettu laittomasta soijasta. Kananmunan lesitiinissä on paljon hyvää, ja Elaine ei näe syytä lisätä sitä ruokavalioon lisäravinteena. Lisäksi, katso Carlosons kalaöljy:  http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/carlsons-fish-oil/

Soijakastike.name: Soijakastike
Soijakastike.description: Soijakastike on fermentoitu soija- tuote ja sisältää myös vehnää, joten se on laitonta.

Mausteet.name: Mausteet
Mausteet.description: Kaikkia mausteita voidaan käyttää, mutta vältä maustesekoituksia. Osta mausteet erillään toisistaan.

spirulina.name: spirulina
spirulina.description: Emme käytä leviä (Spirulina) koska immuunijärjestelmä vaikuttaa IBD:hen, ja levät voivat ärsyttää jo häiriintynyttä immuunijärjestelmää.

Splenda.name: Splenda
Splenda.description: On useita syitä, miksi se on laitonta, katso Spenda: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/splenda/

kurpitsa.name: kurpitsa
kurpitsa.description: Sekä talvi- että kesäkurpitsat ovat laillisia.

Stevia.name: Stevia
Stevia.description: Sen molekyylirakenne muistuttaa steroidia ja sen vaikutukset ovat tuntemattomia. Katso, Stevia: http://www.breakingtheviciouscycle.info/knowledge_base/detail/stevia/

sukraloosi.name: sukraloosi
sukraloosi.description: On useita syitä, miksi se on laitonta, katso Spenda: http://www.breakingtheviciouscycle.info/knowledge_base/detail/splenda/

ksylitoli.name: ksylitoli
ksylitoli.description: Sorbitoli, mannitoli ja ksylitoli ovat kaikki sokerialkoholeja ja eivät ole SCD™ ruokavalion mukaan laillisia. Ne ovat sokereita joita ihmisen keho ei pysty käsittelemään. Usein niin sanotut sokerittomat tuotteet sisältävät näitä, ja nämä sokerit ruokkivat ruuansulatuksen bakteereja.

Jogurtti (kaupan).name: Jogurtti (kaupan)
Jogurtti (kaupan).description: Kaupasta ostettu jogurtti ei ole laillista. Kaupallista jogurttia voidaan käyttää juurena kotitekoisella jogurtille. Ohjeita varten avaa linkki: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/yogurt-commercially-produced/

Jogurtti (kotitekoinen).name: Jogurtti (kotitekoinen)
Jogurtti (kotitekoinen).description: Katso ohjeet nettisivuilta, miten tehdään laillista jogurttia: http://btvc.webfactional.com/knowledge-base/detail/yoghurt-how-to-make-with-yoghurtmaker/

Saksanpähkinä.name: Saksanpähkinä
Saksanpähkinä.description: Pähkinöitä tulisi käyttää vain jauhoina ruuanlaitossa, kunnes ripuli on hellittänyt.

Wasabi.name: Wasabi
Wasabi.description: Niin kauan kuin se on sen luonnollisessa tilassa, ja siihen ei ole lisätty lisäaineita valmistajan toimesta.

viini.name: viini
viini.description: Erittäin kuiva viini on laillista. Katso viini osio nettisivuilta lisätietoja varten viinistä.
